body_html:
@peterjc123 Thank you for all of your incredible work on getting this working. All of us with OS restrictions are grateful. I'm getting a RuntimeError: CUDNN_STATUS_BAD_PARAM
error which fails at a call to conv2d when I try to run my neural network using your legacy conda package on Windows 7. I'm confident that the CUDNN stuff is properly setup on my machine because tensorflow is working fine. Do you have any recommendations for how to solve this? Oddly, the code that others have been using in previous posts also works fine:

# CUDA TEST
import torch
from torch.autograd import Variable
from torch import nn
x = torch.Tensor([1.0])
xx = x.cuda()
print(xx)

from torch.backends import cudnn
print(cudnn.is_acceptable(xx)) # This prints True

word_embedding = nn.Embedding(10, 300).cuda()
bio_embedding = nn.Embedding(10, 32).cuda()

word_input = Variable(torch.LongTensor([[1,2,4,5],[4,3,2,9]]).cuda())
bio_input = Variable(torch.LongTensor([[1,2,4,5],[4,3,2,9]]).cuda())
wb = word_embedding(word_input)
bb = bio_embedding(bio_input)

input_emd = torch.cat((wb, bb), dim=2)
print(input_emd.size())
loss = input_emd.sum()
print(loss)
loss.backward()

body:
@peterjc123 Thank you for all of your incredible work on getting this working. All of us with OS restrictions are grateful. I'm getting a `RuntimeError: CUDNN_STATUS_BAD_PARAM` 
error which fails at a call to conv2d when I try to run my neural network using your legacy conda package on Windows 7. I'm confident that the CUDNN stuff is properly setup on my machine because tensorflow is working fine. Do you have any recommendations for how to solve this? Oddly, the code that others have been using in previous posts also works fine:
```
# CUDA TEST
import torch
from torch.autograd import Variable
from torch import nn
x = torch.Tensor([1.0])
xx = x.cuda()
print(xx)

from torch.backends import cudnn
print(cudnn.is_acceptable(xx)) # This prints True

word_embedding = nn.Embedding(10, 300).cuda()
bio_embedding = nn.Embedding(10, 32).cuda()

word_input = Variable(torch.LongTensor([[1,2,4,5],[4,3,2,9]]).cuda())
bio_input = Variable(torch.LongTensor([[1,2,4,5],[4,3,2,9]]).cuda())
wb = word_embedding(word_input)
bb = bio_embedding(bio_input)

input_emd = torch.cat((wb, bb), dim=2)
print(input_emd.size())
loss = input_emd.sum()
print(loss)
loss.backward()
```
